contrasts.commentary: Negative phrasing leans into friction and risk; positive phrasing centers on outcomes and reliability.
Pain points collect around what blocks progress; outcomes language highlights what payoffs people notice.

recommendations.message: Anchor updates to the concrete outcomes people cite; preempt the top two pain points with proof and timelines.
Prioritize fixes where negative language clusters; validate wins using the positive terms users already volunteer.
